list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment:
Code-cleanup-time! The index router got cleaned up and (finally) the database-methods were moved to another file! The website fonts have been moved from scss to regular css, due to some errors. Advanced features are now optional for the true/false option in the webinterface. Also some labeling has happened. Added some debug to the front-end javascript. Just in case... Also set some alt-text for images. Removed some useless logging infos. Adjusted file spacing and layout. The clientinfo endpoint now shows CloudFlare infos. Adjusted the block styling to be more compact. Sass middleware's debug is now environment dependent. Redirected to the new 404 site, and 500 site. (On the apache webserver)
Added: - Front-end debug - New db file - Advanced features
Modified: - Index-router looks better and content got moved to another file - Labeling on front end - Alt-text for images! - Clientinfo adjusted to reflect CloudFlare - Sass middleware's debug is now environment dependent - Fonts have been moved from scss to regular css
Removed: - Removed some useless logging infos

replaceStrings.replace: connection.query('UPDATE `smartblocks`.`blocks` SET lastactive = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP WHERE mac = ?;', [req.params.mac]);

task.summary:
The Blocks identify themselves with their Mac-address instead of a predefined UUID. Users are now able to edit their block's name. Also introduced some minor bug-fixes like getting the status of the blocks two times a second instead of one.
Added: - Added the ability to update a block's name - Added background while the actual particle background loads... Because why not.
Modified: - The size of the smartblock's name on the main site is now appropriately scaled - Font size and family are now reunited in their own css rule in block.css - Also added the css rules for the name change buttons and text inputs - Code cleanup in block.html and index.html - The index route's variables now use "let" instead of "var" - Moved the creation of the Database from the endpoint declaration into it's own function for easy editing - Cleanup of some unused code
Removed: - The IP-check for CloudFlare was removed - Removed the idea of a custom logger. I'm probably going to add it back in later.
Todo: - The /api/update/:mac/entry/:key/:value endpoint actually does not update the key... yet.

Refined the MAC-Address handling, added Google Analytics. Yes. Adjusted the language to be more consistent. Also tried to add a websocket server for the website to reduce the amount of HTTP-Request (WIP).
Added: - Google's Tag-Manager - A 404 site. - Loading Icon - Specified a name for blocks without one - The parsing of the 'r' url-parameter which displays the user, that this is on a new domain - A simple imprint for legal reasons - Websocketserver for testing purposes
Modified: - Css is now rendered from scss in scss/* - Everything is now in english - Updated robots.txt to exclude errors
Removed: - Removed unnecessary debug statements - Removed unnecessary conversions to JSON-Objects and vice versa - Removed the populateJson test - Removed pictures

Code-cleanup-time! The index router got cleaned up and (finally) the database-methods were moved to another file! The website fonts have been moved from scss to regular css, due to some errors. Advanced features are now optional for the true/false option in the webinterface. Also some labeling has happened. Added some debug to the front-end javascript. Just in case... Also set some alt-text for images. Removed some useless logging infos. Adjusted file spacing and layout. The clientinfo endpoint now shows CloudFlare infos. Adjusted the block styling to be more compact. Sass middleware's debug is now environment dependent. Redirected to the new 404 site, and 500 site. (On the apache webserver)
Added: - Front-end debug - New db file - Advanced features
Modified: - Index-router looks better and content got moved to another file - Labeling on front end - Alt-text for images! - Clientinfo adjusted to reflect CloudFlare - Sass middleware's debug is now environment dependent - Fonts have been moved from scss to regular css
Removed: - Removed some useless logging infos

MESSAGE.value:
First webpage done, contains automatic discovery of smartblocks. The Background contains particles.js.
Added: - Fonts added - Cards are generated on the fly. Rendered background is added afterwards. - Webpage background is generated.
Modified:
Removed:

The Blocks identify themselves with their Mac-address instead of a predefined UUID Users are now able to edit their block's name. Also introduced some minor bug-fixes like getting the status of the blocks two times a second instead of one.
Added: - Added the ability to update a block's name -
Modified: - The size of the smartblock's name on the main site is now appropriately scaled - Font size and family are now reunited in their own css rule in block.css - Also added the css rules for the name change buttons and text inputs - Code cleanup in block.html and index.html - The index route's variables now use "let" instead of "var" - Moved the creation of the Database from the endpoint declaration into it's own function for easy editing -
Removed: - The IP-check for CloudFlare was removed - Removed the idea of a custom logger. I'm probably going to add it back in later.

Removed: - The IP-check for CloudFlare was removed - Removed the idea of a custom logger. I'm probably going to add it back in later.
